metadata.title: CVE-2023-1206 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A hash collision flaw was found in the IPv6 connection lookup table in theLinux kernelâ€™s IPv6 functionality when a user makes a new kind of SYN floodattack. A user located in the local network or with a high bandwidthconnection can increase the CPU usage of the server that accepts IPV6connections up to 95%.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-lowlatency - 4.15.0-219.230
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-164-generic - 5.4.0-164.181~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-164-lowlatency - 5.4.0-164.181~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-219.230').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-164.181~18.04.1').
